result.execSummary:
The defendant Tristin Drew Potter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tristin Drew Potter

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tristin Drew Potter in court.  Attorney Gregory T Ryan Jr. in court for Tristin Drew Potter.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

As to count 1; Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court orders count to be dismissed and read in.

AS TO COUNT TWO; Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2; Negotiations placed on the record. Upon the motion of the County. Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, Sec. 947.01, Wis. Stats., to which Defendant plead no contest. Defendant found guilty of amended charge.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
AS TO COUNT 2; Defendant ordered to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 0 days time served, Huber Privileges for work. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 9 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/28/2022.
- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment
- Random UA's and breathalyzers. 
- Complete mental health evaluation and comply with recommendations. 
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- Complete firearm safety course.
- Complete 20 hours of community service.
- Complete cognitive thinking course.
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/28/2022 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept
- Court finds defendant to be eligible for expungement upon successful completion of the terms of probation.
- Court has NO OBJECTION to probation transfer to Sheboygan County, WI. 
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Defendant Tristin Drew Potter in court with attorney Gregory T Ryan.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status conference. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Tristin Drew Potter in court with Attorney Gregory T Ryan.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court sets date as requested.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD.Case calendared for a Status Conference. Judge is out ill and ordered case adjourned.
Per telephone call with Attorney Ryan new date selected. This hearing will be held via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Status conference on May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  Defendant is currently not working and may qualify for a public defender.  Court ordered the defendant to contact the public defender's office to be reevaluated.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: 
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Tristin Drew Potter in court.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge  Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/7/22 @ 1:30p
